title: Geekbench removes four years of Samsung Galaxy benchmarks following GOS ‘throttling’ debacle [U]
content:
Benchmarks are never fully indicative of how a device will actually perform in real life, but they can provide some useful points of comparison between closely matched devices. Geekbench, one of the best benchmarking apps available across platforms, has just announced that it will remove results from the past few years of Samsung Galaxy devices over a recent software debacle.

more…

The post Geekbench removes four years of Samsung Galaxy benchmarks following GOS ‘throttling’ debacle [U] appeared first on 9to5Google.
description: After finding out that Samsung adjusts the performance of Android apps through its GOS software, Geekbench has removed many Galaxy devices.
